comments.body:
Hey PH community! ðŸ‘‹ Anton here, creator of Lovable

We've received lots of feedback that people love the speed of AI, but crave the control over granular changes that design tools offer.

We've fixed this.

Introducing Visual Edits to Lovable.

What's new?âœ¨

Changes to your Lovable projects could previously be made through prompting our AI, or committing code changes directly to Github.

Now, you can directly change text or components in the app interface. Edits there are instant and do not require a prompt to Lovable.

How to use Visual Edits in Lovable:
1. In the editor, you will then see a new button called "Edit" in the prompt box
2. Click "Edit" and select the element you want to change

3. Edit the element with any of our controls - or by applying custom Tailwind classes

Whether you are a designer, a developer, or have another background -- We think that this is the first step towards an entirely new way of building software.

This is of course just the beginning and we're already envisioning countless additions to the MVP. Would love your feedback & hear what you'd love to see added!

Anton
comments.bodyHtml:
Hey PH community! ðŸ‘‹ Anton here, creator of Lovable

We've received lots of feedback that people love the speed of AI, but crave the control over granular changes that design tools offer.

We've fixed this.

Introducing Visual Edits to Lovable.

What's new?âœ¨

Changes to your Lovable projects could previously be made through prompting our AI, or committing code changes directly to Github.

Now, you can directly change text or components in the app interface. Edits there are instant and do not require a prompt to Lovable.

How to use Visual Edits in Lovable:
1. In the editor, you will then see a new button called "Edit" in the prompt box
2. Click "Edit" and select the element you want to change

3. Edit the element with any of our controls - or by applying custom Tailwind classes

Whether you are a designer, a developer, or have another background -- We think that this is the first step towards an entirely new way of building software.

This is of course just the beginning and we're already envisioning countless additions to the MVP. Would love your feedback & hear what you'd love to see added!

Anton

launches.name: Lovable Launched
launches.tagline: Launch and discover new Lovable apps by Lovable

comments.body:
Many people asked how to get their first users to their apps. Lovable built "Lovable Launched" to make this easier + it's a place where you can find useful apps built with Lovable.

Fun fact: the entire platform was built using Lovable.

launches.name: Lovable
launches.tagline: The world's first AI Full Stack Engineer

comments.body: Hey PH fam! ðŸ‘‹ Anton here, creator of Lovable As a founder, I have always felt that building products takes too long. With Lovable, we fix this. Our AI Software Engineer enables developers and non-developers to turn their ideas into products, but 20x faster and using plain English instead of code. In contrast to other codegen tools, Lovable reliably replicates the capabilities of a full stack engineer and handles everything from UI to database operations. Connect your project to Supabase with one click and build more sophisticated apps with backend capabilities in Lovable. No more coding needed to build apps with working backends. Quick shoutout to our amazing community that has supported us since launch of our first version, GPT Engineer, which quickly grew to 1,000+ new frontend apps built daily, and got 5/5 reviews here on PH. We're excited for the next chapter. ðŸ”¥ So what's new in Lovable? Full stack development: Connect your Lovable project to Supabase to add backend capabilities to your app, like Stripe subscriptions, data storage, user authentication, email sending, and even AI features, built with prompts. Precision edits: Never look back on unwanted changes. Select-to-edit lets you choose the exact components you want the AI to change. Large codebase support: Lovable can now build significantly larger codebases than other AI tools, handling 100,000+ lines of code. Templates: Get inspired and kick-start creations from a template you like, while still being able to tailor anything with a prompt to Lovable. Our 2-way Github integration lets you combine in-app prompts and Github commits and ship to market faster than ever before with one-click deployment. ðŸ’¡ What are Lovable users shipping? User-facing applications: ðŸ“² SaaS with API integrations (Example: Wiktok, TikTok meets Wikipedia) âœ¨ AI-powered Micro SaaS (Example: Renamify) ðŸ‘¨â€ðŸ’»Developer tool (Example: CSS animation playground) Business applications & internal tools: ðŸ”’ Content analysis / brand compliance tool (Example: Guideline guru) ðŸ§™â€â™‚ï¸ Niche use case application (Example: Background Remover) ðŸ“‘ Productivity tool (Example: (Recharts: PDF suit with PDF-lib)) Personal, business or event websites: ðŸŽ¨ Advanced, stylized landing page (Example: Plainly simple) ðŸŒŽ Website with interactive map (Example: Elect Map) ðŸŒˆ Common SaaS landing page (Example: iVisual) Near-instant product prototypes to validate and find PMF faster: Lovable canâ€™t yet build large SaaS like Salesforce, but it can build a CRM tailored to your needs, or an MVP of any large SaaS to validate customersâ€™ willingness to pay. ðŸ‘¥ Who is Lovable for? Founders, solopreneurs & indie-hackers that want to start validating prototypes in minutes and launch a full product in less than a day Designers seeking to bring design prototypes to life instantly without tedious wireframing CTOs looking to involve non-technical colleagues in product development Technical operators building internal tools that precisely match company needs Generalist + backend engineers that want to build beautiful Frontend faster Try Lovable today and claim an exclusive 20% Launch day discount via this code at checkout: PHLAUNCH-24 Tell us what youâ€™re building in the comments âœ¨ðŸš€

comments.body: Huge congrats to the team on launching Lovable today! I'm intrigued by the promise of shipping apps 20x faster with an AI Full Stack Engineer. Can you share a rough estimate of how much dev expertise is still required to effectively work with Lovable, or is it truly accessible to non-coders too?
comments.bodyHtml: Huge congrats to the team on launching Lovable today! I'm intrigued by the promise of shipping apps 20x faster with an AI Full Stack Engineer. Can you share a rough estimate of how much dev expertise is still required to effectively work with Lovable, or is it truly accessible to non-coders too?

replies.body: @ihuzaifashoukat Awesome question! I'd say Lovable is flexible. For example, you can be a complete beginner and just say: "Build me website for my SaaS startup in the food delivery domain. Make it in neo-brutalist design style" and it will build it for you. Then you can connect it to Supabase do add some data storage or even their buckets to save your images. Arguably, if you are a dev or more technical, some of these things will be easier for you since you already know concepts of databases, backend, auth, security... We also have docs that can help on your journey: https://docs.lovable.dev/introdu...
replies.bodyHtml: @ihuzaifashoukat Awesome question! I'd say Lovable is flexible. For example, you can be a complete beginner and just say: "Build me website for my SaaS startup in the food delivery domain. Make it in neo-brutalist design style" and it will build it for you. Then you can connect it to Supabase do add some data storage or even their buckets to save your images. Arguably, if you are a dev or more technical, some of these things will be easier for you since you already know concepts of databases, backend, auth, security... We also have docs that can help on your journey: https://docs.lovable.dev/introdu...

comments.body:
Weve built so much and more with Lovable already! Really cant express enough how impressed I am with the application!

IN DAYS NOT MONTHS WE HAVE BUILT:

- A startup that got top 10 on Product Hunt.

- A internal tool for a large 700 person enterprise team.

- Countless internal tools to help us work faster.

Anton, Fabian and the rest of the team have truly built something wonderful here. Great job!

replies.body: @bensyverson Thank you! GitHub integration is awesome - we've seen users inventing new workflows - they work in Lovable, connect with their own GitHub repos and then work on that codebase using some other IDE. It all syncs nicely which is very neat.

launches.name: gptengineer.app
launches.tagline: Rapid prototyping of web apps using English

comments.body: Go read this thread to grok this .
comments.bodyHtml: Go read this thread to grok this .

replies.body: Thanks for hunting us @chrismessina! The story behind gptengineer.app is that we noticed that AI devtools miss the "super fast feedback" that you get when you ask for high level changes in plain english, see the full result instantly (not see the code), then correct the AI if it misunderstood anything. This is what lead us to build gptengineer.app. Even as a developer, the flow of gptengineer.app is much faster in the initial prototyping stages. After prototyping is done and it's deployed, it's all backed by git. This means that human developers can also jump in, and push back to git to deploy their changes â€“ while non-technical people keep doing changes with plain English. Looking forward to get feedback and input from the entire Product Hunt community! Also, here is our discord: https://discord.gg/ScRPRkvRTf I'll be here to answer any comments.
replies.bodyHtml: Thanks for hunting us @chrismessina! The story behind gptengineer.app is that we noticed that AI devtools miss the "super fast feedback" that you get when you ask for high level changes in plain english, see the full result instantly (not see the code), then correct the AI if it misunderstood anything. This is what lead us to build gptengineer.app. Even as a developer, the flow of gptengineer.app is much faster in the initial prototyping stages. After prototyping is done and it's deployed, it's all backed by git. This means that human developers can also jump in, and push back to git to deploy their changes â€“ while non-technical people keep doing changes with plain English. Looking forward to get feedback and input from the entire Product Hunt community! Also, here is our discord: https://discord.gg/ScRPRkvRTf I'll be here to answer any comments.

replies.body: @antonosika, Kudos on launching gptengineer.app! ðŸŒŸ You've bridged a crucial gap in AI development tools, introducing instant, plain-English feedback and seamless transition from AI prototyping to human-led development. A true milestone for both tech and non-tech innovators alike

A true milestone for both tech and non-tech innovators alike

replies.body: @chrismessina Hey Chris--This is actually something Cheat Layer supported 4 months ago, with instant publishing to github and Vercel https://youtu.be/ZsopVcNa68M The latest version now has many more features that gptengineer.app like adding dalle3 images, stable diffusion videos, and selecting specific elements to edit them live: https://youtu.be/ujghCjfkY48

replies.body: @antonosika I'm currently working on a coding project. If you'd like, I can provide a real review for this product. The job would require a GPT-engineer to review my current codebase and further develop it. I'm not a coder; I know some HTML and CSS, but with this basic knowledge, I've been able to use GPT coding to piece together things I never thought were possible. Now, I'm undertaking the most challenging task so far (for me). Let's see if the GPT-engineer has what it takes to make a product SaaS-ready and get it approved on Codecanyon!
replies.bodyHtml: @antonosika I'm currently working on a coding project. If you'd like, I can provide a real review for this product. comments.body: Congratulations to the gptengineer.app team on the incredible launch on Producthunt! You're definitely revolutionizing how web apps are built and deployed. An interesting suggestion might be to consider integrating a visual aid or graphic interface in the process, so non-tech users can better understand the architecture of their app as they iterate in plain English. Looking forward to seeing your continuous growth and success!
